transcript.text: shabbat shalom happy first day of the
feast of unleavened bread it is April
12th 2017 and it is now the first day of
unleavened bread I just wanted to share
some pictures from the Passover Seder
dinner that we had yesterday there's me
with my staff in my hand as we're eating
the Passover had a very joyous effort
with a lot of a lot of friends was even
able to invite a co-worker and her
family to the Passover and it was just
very festive and joyous event in fact I
didn't get back home until midnight last
night but of course now we begin the
seven days of unleavened bread
this first day is a high Sabbath and
then the seventh day will be a high
Shabbat and as Apostle Paul urges us he
says let us therefore keep the feast
with the unleavened bread of sincerity
and truth you know so many people seem
to think that Apostle Paul said that we
don't need to keep these feasts but it's
very clear that not only did he keep the
feasts but all the early disciples kept
these feasts because as he also says in
another passage of Scripture these
feasts are are a shadow of things to
come
continuing to teach us things that are
still yet in the future and he wrote
that well after the resurrection I've
made many many videos in the past about
Passover and unleavened bread and the
symbols of what this all means but I
want to just wish everyone a very happy
happy Jubilee year a very I hope you all
have a very festive Passover season and
let us truly keep this feast with with
sincerity and with truth this unleavened
bread you know it represents how he was
pierced you know you take a piece of
unleavened bread it has all those holes
and those stripes so it's how he was
pierced and beaten for our
transgressions but also there's no
leaven there's no scent he was the
perfect sinless sacrifice and he allows
us the reason we clean out all the lemon
from our homes and we take these seven
days to be unleavened to only eat
unleavened bread is because it shows how
he then fills our hearts and helps us to
be unleavened he cleans out the sin from
our lives and helps us to be a holy and
pure that we can only do through his
indwelling spirit they can only do by
him taking the throne of our hearts it's
a very beautiful thing that he does and
he's continuing to bring us closer and
closer and closer to him it's continuing
to allow the fruits of the spirit love
joy peace patience goodness kindness
gentleness temperance self-control
meekness all these fruits of the spirit
he's continuing to help them to grow
more and more in our lives so shabbat
shalom happy first day of unleavened
bread the first high Sabbath I'm sorry I
would love to have used my iPad to
actually record more of last night but
for some reason my iPad is not working
and need to try to get it fixed but but
I do want to make a video just to wish
everyone a very happy feast of Pesach
shabbat shalom this is Daniel John Lee
with Torah restoration ministries
website is spirit and Torah calm
